timeline.message: Wire all the way back to search module
Clean up other uses of VSRegistry.getInstance
Get rid of singleton & weird atomic init guards

timeline.bodyText: I think the old indentation was easier to read.
timeline.author: nik9000
timeline.diffHunk:

replies.bodyText: Yeah, not sure what happened here.  This is neither the old indentation, nor the format we're standardizing on.  I'll fix it.
replies.author: not-napoleon

timeline.bodyText: It look like someone was going with one arg per line here.
timeline.author: nik9000

replies.bodyText: I'm a little confused by this comment - are you saying this should be one line per arg? I think that's what the new auto-formatting would do.
replies.author: not-napoleon

replies.bodyText: When I first looked it at I thought that was what it was and you hadn't followed. On second look it wasn't. Sorry! Ignore me.
replies.author: nik9000

timeline.author: nik9000

timeline.bodyText: Do you still like the idea of changing the ctor to take an Iterable? Is that a thing for a follow up change?
timeline.author: nik9000

replies.bodyText: I didn't see a clean way to do this.  We already manually list all the aggregations once in registerAggregations, and that still feels like the right place to hook in the values source mappings for each aggregation.  To do that in the constructor, I'd basically need to duplicate that list.  I thought briefly about some kind of visitor pattern to cover both uses, but it seemed like a lot of boiler plate that didn't add any clarity.  If you've got a good idea for how we could make this cleaner, I'm happy to work with you on it, but I don't see a better way than what we're doing now.
replies.author: not-napoleon

replies.bodyText: I think it is cool to merge as is and grab that in a follow up. Would it be ok if I gave it a shot myself once this is in?
replies.author: nik9000
